title: Q vs K - which initial conc. forms more product

content.description:
<math alttext="X 2, gas, plus Y 2, gas, is in equilibrium with 2 X Y, gas; K sub c equals 3.0" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>X</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>Y</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>⇄</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>XY</mtext> <mtext>(</mtext> <mi>g</mi> <mtext>) </mtext> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="1.0em"> </mspace> <msub> <mrow> <mi>K</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>c</mi> </mrow> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3.0</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

A mixture of <math alttext="X 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="Y 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="X Y, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in a previously evacuated, rigid container and allowed to reach equilibrium at a constant temperature, as shown above.
content.question: Which of the following sets of initial concentrations would lead to the formation of more product as the system moves toward equilibrium?

choices.label: <math alttext="the molar concentration of X 2, sub initial" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[X</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> <math alttext="the molar concentration of Y 2, sub initial" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[Y</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> <math alttext="the molar concentration of X Y, sub initial" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[XY]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> <math alttext="0.40 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.40 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.20 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
